page.title: 04SERVICES IN WENSLEYDALE
page.content: Most homes in the villages of Aysgarth, Thoralby and West Burton have mains water, sewage, electricity and a telephone. There is no piped gas in this area, as it is too remote. All three villages have a village shop and post office and there is a butcher's shop in West Burton. In Aysgarth there are one or two craft and specialist shops, eg a wine and cheese shop and a clog-maker. All the villages have a public house serving food and offering bed and breakfast accommodation. Most people not employed in tourism or farming work outside the villages, some travelling as far as Darlington & Northallerton to work. A car is an essential for any family, as the one bus service has been reduced to 2 buses daily and the railway station at Aysgarth closed in the 1950's.
